Dangote Refinery Test Invitation - Jobs/Vacancies - Nigeria posted by
I got an invitation on my mail this evening from Dangote Career asking me to show up for an aptitude test and interview that will be coming up on the 10th October, 2015.

Please, find below the message I got on my mail:

Please note that the actual test is 120 minutes long; multiple-choice questions test that will help us learn about your abilities. Also, kindly bring the copy of the test invitation email during the test session. You may please find attached to this email a copy of a syllabus under your discipline to enable you prepare effectively.
Date: 10th October 2015
Time: 2PM-4pm (Please arrive at least 1 hour before the test for verification)
Venue: Nigerian Law school, Ozumba Mbadiwe Street, Victoria Island. Lagos state
Dress Code: Business Casual
Test Requirements:
- Valid means of identification (international Passport/ Drivers license/National ID card/).
- Bring a copy of any recently taken passport photograph.
- Proof of Academic Credentials (Statement of result/ Graduation certificate, NYSC certificate)
- Basic test stationery (Calculator, Mathematical set, ball pens)
We extend our warmest congratulations on reaching this stage and look forward to getting to know you better in the coming weeks.
We thank you for your interest in working with Dangote Group.

Talent Recruitment Team

Jarus
JarusHub is organizing Mock Test to prepare you.


JARUSHUB DANGOTE MOCK TEST

JarusHub is a Nigerian startup with focus on careers and employability skills improvement.

We have prepared more than 150 people for interviews of top companies, including NNPC, Oando, KPMG, NLNG, PwC and Afrinvest and a good number of our enrollees were successful.

We are conducting a Mock Test for the forthcoming Dangote Test.

A mock test is a just a test that prepares you for the real test. We gather experts together in the disciplines to use the information given to you to guess questions and you will sit down and write the test. We will then give you feedback and correct you on what you need to work on.

There will also be mock group discussions. We have done this for many companies in the past and have had sessions in Lagos, Abuja and Port Harcourt.

Most of our trainers are First Class graduates of top disciplines who are test experts.

Our fee is N3000 per participant. And this is a subsidised fee as such services go for as much as $300 (60k) in other countries.

Date for this Mock Test will be communicated when we firm up things with our experts.

Venue is JarusHub office, 59 Queen Street, Alagomeji, Yaba, Lagos
Venue is JarusHub office, 59 Queen Street, Alagomeji, Yaba, Lagos
Date: Thursday, 8th October
Time 10am

To register, send an email to jarushub@gmail.com or call Kabir on 08060482880 or Mathew on 09092989936

http://www.jarushub.com/interview-coaching/

QUDUSKUNLE:
I got an invitation on my mail this evening from Dangote Career asking me to show up for an aptitude test and interview that will be coming up on the 10th October, 2015.

Please, find below the message I got on my mail:

Please note that the actual test is 120 minutes long; multiple-choice questions test that will help us learn about your abilities. Also, kindly bring the copy of the test invitation email during the test session. You may please find attached to this email a copy of a syllabus under your discipline to enable you prepare effectively.
Date: 10th October 2015
Time: 2PM-4pm (Please arrive at least 1 hour before the test for verification)
Venue: Nigerian Law school, Ozumba Mbadiwe Street, Victoria Island. Lagos state
Dress Code: Business Casual
Test Requirements:
- Valid means of identification (international Passport/ Drivers license/National ID card/).
- Bring a copy of any recently taken passport photograph.
- Proof of Academic Credentials (Statement of result/ Graduation certificate, NYSC certificate)
- Basic test stationery (Calculator, Mathematical set, ball pens)
We extend our warmest congratulations on reaching this stage and look forward to getting to know you better in the coming weeks.
We thank you for your interest in working with Dangote Group.

Talent Recruitment Team

okyodic:



Can u please send a copy of d syllabus? okyodic@yahoo.com

QUESTIONS COVERED FROM THE FOLLOWING AREAS FOR WRITTEN TEST DISCIPLINE WISE

INSTRUMENTATION :
Basic Circuits and measurement system
Metrology, mechanical measurements and Industrial Instrumentation
Analog Circuits
Digital Circuits
Signals and Systems
Control Systems
Communications
Electrical and Electronic Measurements
Analytical, optical and bio medical instrumentation

ELECTRICAL:
Electrical Circuits and Fields
Electrical Machines
Analog Circuits
Digital Circuits
Signals and Systems
Control Systems
Power Systems
Electrical and Electronic Measurements
8085 Microprocessor
Power Electronics and Drivers

MECHANICAL
Engineering Mechanics
Strength of Materials
Theory of Machines
Vibrations
Design of Machine elements
Fluid Mechanics
Heat Transfer
Thermodynamics
Engineering Materials
Metal Casting
Forming Process
Metal Joining Process
Machining and Machine Tool Operations
Metrology and Inspection
Computer integrated Manufacturing
Production, Planning and Control
Inventory Control
Operation research
CIVIL
Structural Engineering
Geotechnical Engineering
Water Resources Engineering
Environmental Engineering
Transportation Engineering
Surveying
CHEMICAL
Process Calculations & Thermodynamics
Fluid Mechanics and Mechanical Operations
Heat Transfer
Mass Transfer
Chemical Reaction Engineering
Instrumentation & Process Control
Plant design and Economics
Chemical Technology

I got an invitation on my mail this evening from Dangote Career asking me to show up for an aptitude test and interview that will be coming up on the 10th October, 2015.

Please, find below the message I got on my mail:

Please note that the actual test is 120 minutes long; multiple-choice questions test that will help us learn about your abilities. Also, kindly bring the copy of the test invitation email during the test session. You may please find attached to this email a copy of a syllabus under your discipline to enable you prepare effectively.
Date: 10th October 2015
Time: 2PM-4pm (Please arrive at least 1 hour before the test for verification)
Venue: Nigerian Law school, Ozumba Mbadiwe Street, Victoria Island. Lagos state
Dress Code: Business Casual
Test Requirements:
- Valid means of identification (international Passport/ Drivers license/National ID card/).
- Bring a copy of any recently taken passport photograph.
- Proof of Academic Credentials (Statement of result/ Graduation certificate, NYSC certificate)
- Basic test stationery (Calculator, Mathematical set, ball pens)
We extend our warmest congratulations on reaching this stage and look forward to getting to know you better in the coming weeks.

sentaljohn:

my GMAT ability is not so good.. I guess I gotta work more.

how abt the other section where they said we'll b tested in our field (written test) and also the group discussion aspect.?

You still have 9days to brush up ur gmat skills. As for the other section, its going to be key points on ur field. Your composure matters a lot. Remember, you are going to be trained immediately after being employed.
...And again, Pray harder
egwuenuchris
@ForteNL...Pls bro you scaled thru this process.Can you share how long it takes Dangrote Group to complete their recruitment process. I mean now that we are writing the test next week. When 'if successful' are we expected to resume. And what is the test like (technical test), kind of questions asked during the group discussions and interviews
egwuenuchris:
@ForteNL...Pls bro you scaled thru this process.Can you share how long it takes Dangrote Group to complete their recruitment process. I mean now that we are writing the test next week. When 'if successful' are we expected to resume. And what is the test like (technical test), kind of questions asked during the group discussions and interviews

Dangote Group has no specific time when it comes to recruitment. The recruitments process before mine took just 3months (from submission of CV to the resumption date). Mine took 7months. I remember waiting for 2months after aptititute test before interview and another 2months after interview before resumption. So, they are not too specific when it comes to timing. The first section of the test is purely gmat(general engineering) while the other section are questions on ur field. The group discussions and the interview will depend on the panel you fall in...They dont normally ask the same questions. Just be prepared to apply ur listening skills as you maybe interviewed by Indians.
lamash
ForteNL:


Dangote Group has no specific time when it comes to recruitment. The recruitments process before mine took just 3months (from submission of CV to the resumption date). Mine took 7months. I remember waiting for 2months after aptititute test before interview and another 2months after interview before resumption. So, they are not too specific when it comes to timing. The first section of the test is purely gmat(general engineering) while the other section are questions on ur field. The group discussions and the interview will depend on the panel you fall in...They dont normally ask the same questions. Just be prepared to apply ur listening skills as you maybe interviewed by Indians.

Jarus
JarusHub is organizing Mock Test to prepare you.


JARUSHUB DANGOTE MOCK TEST

JarusHub is a Nigerian startup with focus on careers and employability skills improvement.

We have prepared more than 150 people for interviews of top companies, including NNPC, Oando, KPMG, NLNG, PwC and Afrinvest and a good number of our enrollees were successful.

We are conducting a Mock Test for the forthcoming Dangote Test.

A mock test is a just a test that prepares you for the real test. We gather experts together in the disciplines to use the information given to you to guess questions and you will sit down and write the test. We will then give you feedback and correct you on what you need to work on.

There will also be mock group discussions. We have done this for many companies in the past and have had sessions in Lagos, Abuja and Port Harcourt.

Most of our trainers are First Class graduates of top disciplines who are test experts.

Our fee is N3000 per participant. And this is a subsidised fee as such services go for as much as $300 (60k) in other countries.

Date for this Mock Test will be communicated when we firm up things with our experts.

Venue is JarusHub office, 59 Queen Street, Alagomeji, Yaba, Lagos
Venue is JarusHub office, 59 Queen Street, Alagomeji, Yaba, Lagos
Date: Thursday, 8th October
Time 10am

To register, send an email to jarushub@gmail.com or call Kabir on 08060482880 or Mathew on 09092989936

http://www.jarushub.com/interview-coaching/

adebaba500
ForteNL:


Dangote Group has no specific time when it comes to recruitment. The recruitments process before mine took just 3months (from submission of CV to the resumption date). Mine took 7months. I remember waiting for 2months after aptititute test before interview and another 2months after interview before resumption. So, they are not too specific when it comes to timing. The first section of the test is purely gmat(general engineering) while the other section are questions on ur field. The group discussions and the interview will depend on the panel you fall in...They dont normally ask the same questions. Just be prepared to apply ur listening skills as you maybe interviewed by Indians.

dangote group no get too much faith in dre academy. if dey get faith dey wud have recruited batch 4 chemical to refinery instead of publicising it again to masses.
remember in academy employment is not guarantee so no dull ursf oooo
I guess u r batch 5
all da best

adebaba500:

LMAO..Ignorance..five topics? or five branches of Civil Engineering that are all wide and broad ? Have you heard that Civil is the oldest and mother of all Engineering? Structural,Environmental, Transportation,Water resources are all branches of Civil engineering..a Civil engineer specialises in his/her masters to study ONE of all these branches..You cant specialise in two not to talk of all...so my brother..Next time..know what you wish for..cheers

Michaelamo
Dear Applicant,

Further to your test invitations, you are scheduled to be seated in (Hall name: CLASSROOM 1) at the Nigerian Law School Ozumba Mbadiwe Street, Victoria Island, Lagos. Please bring along a print out of this invite and the previously sent invite.

(Petroleum Engineers – Please be aware that you should study the chemical Engineering. Syllabus)

We reiterate:

Dress Code: Business Casual

Test Requirements:

- Valid means of identification (International Passport/ Driver’s license/National ID card/)

- Bring a copy of any recently taken passport photograph.

- Proof of Academic Credentials (Statement of result/ Graduation certificate, NYSC certificate) Originals and one set of photocopies

- Basic test stationery (Calculator, Pencils, Eraser, Mathematical set, ball pens)



Please arrive an hour before the test for your verification.

We thank you once again for your interest in working with Dangote group and wish you the best of luck in your forthcoming test.



Talent Recruitment Team

Please, acknowledge accordingly

Luxzy
please has anyone seen the group discussion questions? i heard they were leaked somewhere online
snowytee
Had my group discussion today.It's nothing to get worked up about.You will be grouped in 12s or so.Your group will be given a topic to discuss.You all will discuss And the panelists will just observe.That's it.Endeavour to contribute in the discussions and don't be too domineering to form group leader and chairman.God's Grace to you my people.

aydrees09
...
Tinkel
Nothing much about the aplitude test, just make sure that you try to get or download relevant materials on the topics that was sent to you on your mail for the text invitation. And also pray for God's favour
Tinkel
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test
tafrica
Tinkel:
.

Thanks for your large heart. I've quoted you on the other thread also.
Your contributions will be religiously kept to when we also get to these stages.

Enjoy your training in india.

My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test

I just received an invite for the GETS 2016, I studied Electrical and computer Engineering. What should I expect please? What is the pattern of their questions? Dou people are mentioning syllabus here but I was not sent any. Urgent reply please
Don't get it twisted sis, what you read here was about Dangote Refinery recruitment which was a different recruitment drive on its own. GETS doesn't come with syllabus attachment like Dangote refinery recruitment.

To your question, read GMAT and other engineering/course related areas.

tafrica
Obilo123:
[As a gradauate of electrical and electronics engineering. Which one will be a better career choice.quote author=tafrica post=50088610]

LOL, choose the one that first comes your way.
Good luck and congrats in advance on the double employments from Chevron and dangote refinery.

Bros, your discipline is applicable in both companies. What might bring the confusion is which company offers better salary, growth prospect, job security etc.
Don't neglect Dangote refinery test invite (if you have perhaps got any) because someone is promising chevron offer. Always spread your tentacles in job search, when multiple offers come, you may now analyze the best and choose the one that suits you best.

All the best in your job search

Olamayk
Tinkel:
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test


Thanks for the info..Please, I will like to have a discussion with you on whatsapp. My number is 08189056570. Thanks

Olumegzy
cesctotti:


It is rarely appropriate to “dress down” for an interview, regardless of company dress code policy. ... You should wear a suit to interviews. “Suit” means the works: a matching jacket and pants, dress shirt, tie, coordinating socks and dress shoes. A dark-colored suit with light colored shirt is your best option.... Smiles

Tinkel:
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test

Tinkel:
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test

2nioshine
covvym:
I just got an invite for dangote refinery test next week. I applied for Graduate Electrical Engineering Trainee, while I’m a graduate of computer science with masters in Information Security, pls I need to know if it is feasible for me to proceed with the quest.
I’ve other certification though, and done (still doing) system-on-chip and embedded devices projects. Any cogent insight will be valuable pls. Contact -> anheron1@gmail.com

In this just concluded recruitment, we had people in their PHD who started out with us .. but note;

since you applied for a GT role most certainly you will be required to come with your first degree cert. Either during your interview or final documentation after a successful medicals( A friend in your shoes believed that was the reason he never made it through the interview, I can't tell though)

Also note that starting from your test to your interview, every thing you will do will be based on the department you applied for. And if you are sure of your self, you can give it a trial. They must have shortlisted you for a reason.

since you applied for a GT role most certainly you will be required to come with your first degree cert. Either during your interview or final documentation after a successful medicals( A friend in your shoes believed that was the reason he never made it through the interview, I can't tell though)

2nioshine
johnsongenius:
Am i the only one that was sent a docx file containing areas covered for the questions?

I don't know if I'm required to read for all the topics or just for my field. These topics are much o!
Any one with an idea?

Yea every thing in there. The topics were carefully selected to cover all /most of the topics in your field. This will guide you in the technical aspect.

The other sections are bunch of india questions (last was from AMCAT) . Indiabix may be of help.
Luck!
solastar2
vicuref:
Plz anyone with useful past questions for d dangote aptitude test, kindly send to my email vicuref@gmail.com for a handsome reward, my area is electrical engineering

Don't let anyone deceive u. There is no one with the past question. Just read to the best of your capability. The questions are not too easy but solveable though. If anyone give you any question, the probability of seeing any of the question on the exam day is closer to zero than 1.

2nioshine
chetmann:
about 150k for fresh graduates.


The pay depends on alot of Factors, but basically on where your training is to take place(Nigeria/abroad)

The amount up there may be applicable to other dangote group or other entry level positions but certainly not this.

Just to add, when assumptions are made it is best to make it known. That way people won't be misguided

alayomini
Tinkel:
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test



Pls do u know of any candidate with HND who got offer for graduate engineering trainee, or is it strictly for B.tech nd B.eng?

Tanx
Flexy99
alayomini:



Kindly check ur account , if ur cv base selection has been cleared and waiting for interview u will surely be invited for interview. Check nd reply me . Ok

alayomini:




Pls do u know of any candidate with HND who got offer for graduate engineering trainee, or is it strictly for B.tech nd B.eng?

Tanx

No HND candidate has done interview let alone receiving offer. Those successful ones from GD where told that their Application is under processing and that is why their status is showing awaiting Interview. So we are still very much hoping they contact us soonest. Though many of us have received offer from other companies. No time to wait. Dangote attended to Bsc 2.1. That's the reason we haven't been contacted. Though we will be contacted soonest.

efetoski
You Can please type out the content of the syllabus for Chemical Engineering.
TOM208
CHEMICAL AND PETROLEUM

Process Calculations & Thermodynamics
Fluid Mechanics and Mechanical Operations
Heat Transfer
Mass Transfer
Chemical Reaction Engineering
Instrumentation & Process Control
Plant design and Economics
Chemical Technology

Fremaxx
Guys if you're not a chemical engineering graduate and you got an invite to the dangote refinery test. Don't bother going. The test is 120 minutes as stated in the mail. Two sections - chemical engineering section and general aptitude questions consisting of numeric 80% and verbal 20%. Each section is 60 minutes. Just prepare wide

Fremaxx
I am just laughing. Somebody listed some topics ranging from heat transfer, mass transfer, chemical thermodynamic, chemical plant economics. Everything was in the test. It was a real test of knowledge. For the general aptitude test mehn read anything as there data interpretation, logical reasoning questions, combination, GRE, cat questions, GMAT. It was a test of speed and knowledge. Just try your best. To tell you what exactly to read. I feel like telling you to read everything

nonye6194
I've tried to read all the comments on this thread up till my comment and here's a summary for those of us newbies. Find gmat and your discipline related past questions to prepare with. The best online preparatory website that was mentioned is

https://www.indiabix.com/


Me sef recommend the site since the questions look like what was set by Indians and the site is an Indian one covering a lot of disciplines.

someone highlighted sections to cover and I'm mentioning just the ones related to my discipline. chemical engineering


CHEMICAL
Process Calculations & Thermodynamics
Fluid Mechanics and Mechanical Operations
Heat Transfer
Mass Transfer
Chemical Reaction Engineering
Instrumentation & Process Control
Plant design and Economics
Chemical Technology

below is a concise summary from a nairalander that underwent the recruitment process and today is a staff with dangote group:

I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test


Here's a general direction for those coming to the venue:


where ever you are coming from, find your way to computer village under bridge at IKEJA, ask for keke maruwa going towards Guinness. drop at Dangote 2nd gate. it's hard to miss. the keke charges just #50. or you can use Lara.ng or Google maps

Here's the final admonishment for those sitting for the test in May 2019 Only :


Guys if you're not a chemical engineering graduate and you got an invite to the dangote refinery test. Don't bother going. The test is 120 minutes as stated in the mail. Two sections - chemical engineering section and general aptitude questions consisting of numeric 80% and verbal 20%. Each section is 60 minutes. Just prepare wide
Makanjuola89
The test is 2 hours (120 mins) as stated in the mail. 1 hour for chemical engineering questions in which you will answer any 100 questions out of 120. Another 1 hour for aptitude test to answer 100 questions comprising of numerical and verbal.

Just go there with a pure mind and don't make it a do or die affair.

As for those who are not chemical engineering graduates and got the invite, the hr guy stated it clearly that it's strictly for chemical engineers. He mentioned a guy who came all the way from Uyo only to find out that it's only chemical engineers that were called but he got the invite. Tho he allowed the guy to write the test because of his far distance but told him that the management will decide on his case. My advice is if you are not a chemical engineering graduate don't even bother going cos I swear you won't be able to answer those chemical questions, you will just be playing games.

For those who are still serving and got invite pls go O. You will be required to show your nysc Id card. A guy who is still serving came for the test and was allowed to write when he showed proof.

For the over Sabi and over religious people, please check your mail very well O you are asked to go with your birth certificate not "baptisms" certificate. A guy presented "baptism" certificate today tho the lady allowed him but warned him against next time. Thank God he didn't meet a sadist.

I wish you all best of luck.
kolidave
bros, how many hours make 120mins?
Makanjuola89:
The test is 2 hours not 120 mins as stated in the mail. 1 hour for chemical engineering questions in which you will answer any 100 questions out of 120. Another 1 hour for aptitude test to answer 100 questions comprising of numerical and verbal.

Just go there with a pure mind and don't make it a do or die affair.

As for those who are not chemical engineering graduates and got the invite, the hr guy stated it clearly that it's strictly for chemical engineers. He mentioned a guy who came all the way from Uyo only to find out that it's only chemical engineers that were called but he got the invite. Tho he allowed the guy to write the test because of his far distance but told him that the management will decide on his case. I wish you all best of luck.

I studied Engineering Geology n I was invited for the technical assessment on 3/06/2019.
Fremaxx
I want to repeat what I have said before in this trend that you should not waste your time, money and energy if you're not a chemical engineer. If you think you have prepared well for the chemical engineering questions and your course is not chemical engineering, please feel free to try your luck. There are two sections. The first is the chemical engineering section which contains 120 multiple choice questions for 60 minutes, the second section is the general aptitude section which contains 100 multiple choice questions for 60 minutes. The general aptitude test is the toughest. I believe the questions are from Indian common admission test with area of concentration on logical reasoning, verbal reasoning and data interpretation. Trust me they are tough without preparation. They are simple with preparation. Just try your best and Good luck.
The advert stated only chemical engineers. The invigilator mentioned it. So don't waste your energy on this recruitment.
lilangel20
Let's us know when you get it o..
Fremaxx:
I want to repeat what I have said before in this trend that you should not waste your time, money and energy if you're not a chemical engineer. If you think you have prepared well for the chemical engineering questions and your course is not chemical engineering, please feel free to try your luck. There are two sections. The first is the chemical engineering section which contains 120 multiple choice questions for 60 minutes, the second section is the general aptitude section which contains 100 multiple choice questions for 60 minutes. The general aptitude test is the toughest. I believe the questions are from Indian common admission test with area of concentration on logical reasoning, verbal reasoning and data interpretation. Trust me they are tough without preparation. They are simple with preparation. Just try your best and Good luck.
The advert stated only chemical engineers. The invigilator mentioned it. So don't waste your energy on this recruitment.
nonye6194
this test isnt about answering everything. a wrong chemical engineering question is -1. a right one is +2. for the quantitative reasoning, wrong takes -0.5 while right one is +1. so you gats to be smart and veryyy fast


And the possibility of finishing these questions in 2 hours is negligible. For me, the easiest part was even the aptitude section. those chemical engineering questions came from hell lol.


then the idea of writing a chemical engineering test for a non chemical engineering candidate is somewhat crazy. well, unless you can withstand it. alot of guys in my hall that were non chemical engineering candidates were literally swearing under their breath. one even went to the extent of submitting the answer booklet unanswered to begin on the aptitude part.

So even if you're invited but the mail states its for another discipline, I'll advise you stay back if you'll borrow money to come for the test.

for those yet to write, make indiabix.com your partner. especially the chemical engineering guys, focus on thermodynamics, heat and mass transfer, fluid mechanics, process control and instrumentation. that's where the bulk of questions came from. if its possible, finish the practice questions on indiabix.com for these courses.


p.s : this is coming from my own experience today after the test. anyone can come to counter this either due to the difference in their own experience or whatever makes them to. But goodluck to everyone!
Unibram

this test isnt about answering everything. a wrong chemical engineering question is -1. a right one is +2. for the quantitative reasoning, wrong takes -0.5 while right one is +1. so you gats to be smart and veryyy fast

then the idea of writing a chemical engineering test for a non chemical engineering candidate is somewhat crazy. well, unless you can withstand it. alot of guys in my hall that were non chemical engineering candidates were literally swearing under their breath. one even went to the extent of submitting the answer booklet unanswered to begin on the aptitude part.

So even if you're invited but the mail states its for another discipline, I'll advise you stay back if you'll borrow money to come for the test.

for those yet to write, make indiabix.com your partner. especially the chemical engineering guys, focus on thermodynamics, heat and mass transfer, fluid mechanics, process control and instrumentation. that's where the bulk of questions came from. if its possible, finish the practice questions on indiabix.com for these courses.


p.s : this is coming from my own experience today after the test. anyone can come to counter this either due to the difference in their own experience or whatever makes them to. But goodluck to everyone!

below is a concise summary from a nairalander that underwent the recruitment process and today is a staff with dangote group:

I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test

JARUSHUB
DANGOTE GROUP DISCUSSION COACHING

If you have been invited for Dangote Group Discussion exercise, you can engage the service of JarusHub, Nigeria's leading career services company, to prepare.

We will coach you on everything needed to succeed at the group discussion and organize a mock group discussion where you will be given topic to discuss in group and we will give you feedback on your performance.

We have done this for past recruitment exercise of top companies.

https://www.jarushub.com/assessment-center-coaching/

The mock session and training holds this week Sunday at our office, 60 Moleye Street, Yaba, Lagos.

For more information and to book appointment, please call 08060482880, 08085404500

EngrVin
Good luck to all called for the group discussion. You have passed the critical part which was the test. For the GD, you are basically been tested on team work. You will be given different topics e.g Agricultural reforms in Nigeria, etc. Ensure you speak out. Two or three Indians will be there to monitor and grade you based on your discussion. Trust me, you have passed the main part.

Hope to see you guys on board soon.

Best Regards

okonebiebi
nonye6194:
I've tried to read all the comments on this thread up till my comment and here's a summary for those of us newbies. Find gmat and your discipline related past questions to prepare with. The best online preparatory website that was mentioned is

https://www.indiabix.com/


Me sef recommend the site since the questions look like what was set by Indians and the site is an Indian one covering a lot of disciplines.

someone highlighted sections to cover and I'm mentioning just the ones related to my discipline. chemical engineering


CHEMICAL
Process Calculations & Thermodynamics
Fluid Mechanics and Mechanical Operations
Heat Transfer
Mass Transfer
Chemical Reaction Engineering
Instrumentation & Process Control
Plant design and Economics
Chemical Technology

below is a concise summary from a nairalander that underwent the recruitment process and today is a staff with dangote group:

I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test


Here's a general direction for those coming to the venue:


where ever you are coming from, find your way to computer village under bridge at IKEJA, ask for keke maruwa going towards Guinness. drop at Dangote 2nd gate. it's hard to miss. the keke charges just #50. or you can use Lara.ng or Google maps

Here's the final admonishment for those sitting for the test in May 2019 Only :


Guys if you're not a chemical engineering graduate and you got an invite to the dangote refinery test. Don't bother going. The test is 120 minutes as stated in the mail. Two sections - chemical engineering section and general aptitude questions consisting of numeric 80% and verbal 20%. Each section is 60 minutes. Just prepare wide
Nonye please add me up on what'sup..+2347062459343, contact me via email: okonebiebi@gmail.com. it's important and urgent bro thanks

lilangel20

kolidave:

kolidave
lilangel20:
Can you share your experience?
you cant really predict where the questions will come from. The interviewer will ask you questions based on what catches his eye on your CV and also what you say, you have to know a lot about whatever you write on your CV (SO DON'T PUT LIES THERE). Its an interactive interview, you can mention the area you are really good at and they might just throw you questions from that. One has to just calm down and carefully listen to what the interviewer says (you might not hear them sometimes so pay attention).
All the best.
Uricas
kolidave:
you cant really predict where the questions will come from. The interviewer will ask you questions based on what catches his eye on your CV and also what you say, you have to know a lot about whatever you write on your CV (SO DON'T PUT LIES THERE). Its an interactive interview, you can mention the area you are really good at and they might just throw you questions from that. One has to just calm down and carefully listen to what the interviewer says (you might not hear them sometimes so pay attention).
All the best.
You are right. Mine was different. I was asked purely chemistry questions. Follow by separation question and was also asked to show and state the cause of something in a distillation column. I didn't used more time because of the type of question and answer they want.
kolidave

Just be confident...know your onions about heat exchangers, vapor liquid equilibrium, dew point, Raoults law, pump chosing requirements, urea production, distillation columns, no of trays..

We at aptware are committed to ensuring our clients recruit the very best talents.
We have noticed that not a lot of candidates are familiar with psychometric and aptitude tests so we are rolling out free practice tests to allow candidates to get used to questions of this type.

Please go ahead and take them https://assess.aptware.io/skill/test/practice. They are completely free to take.

We would appreciate any feedback you have.
For more info, visit us at http://aptware.io

If it was then when psychometric sometimes comes before interview this would have been true. Although your interview performance plays the deciding role in the process.

But still for the executive/Engineer trainee, you get a mail after a successful interview for a psychometric test before medicals. They may be few exceptions but am yet to see one.

Just for clarification.
2nioshine
Uricas:

Thanks for your input. Will there be psychometric feedback message before medical? Or the medical message directly?
Just for clarification.

The next mail after psychometric is the medicals. Usually a call or a text with a follow up mail and it is independent of your psychometric date( ie it can be anyone from any batch on the list) so it can be faster for some and longer for some others
Uricas
2nioshine:

Samhyme
Actually, after your psychometry you will need enough patience to move to the next stage which is medical... Even after medical, you will still need to exercise a lot of patience to get the Visa mail for oversea training. A lot of people are on ground who are awaiting traveling for oversea training and the most important thing is that, this recruitment is unpredictable. You may be called for medical after waiting for 1 year or 1 month. It depends on HR....... so i wish everyone success and the spirit of patience.

Sunnystooth
kolidave:
wow, my partner in waiting. How the waiting dey go na.

Do you think the Psychometric and IQ test stage is another (the final) screening stage in the recruitment process or it's just for formality for those that have scaled through the interview already.

Just curious.
Sunnystooth:


Do you think the Psychometric and IQ test stage is another (the final) screening stage in the recruitment process or it's just for formality for those that have scaled through the interview already.

Just curious.

I think it is another screening stage and not just for formality else, what is its use? The IQ/Personality test will test your suitability for job role and work ethics. Anyone that fails to meet their standards will be rejected.

But personally, I think there is a higher chance of being employed if one reaches this stage.
Sunnystooth
DanXplore:


I think it is another screening stage and not just for formality else, what is its use? The IQ/Personality test will test your suitability for job role and work ethics. Anyone that fails to meet their standards will be rejected.

But personally, I think there is a higher chance of being employed if one reaches this stage.

Does FCC affect private companies too like dangote?
Eggovic:

Does FCC affect private companies too like dangote?

FCC is usually not binding on private companies except its management adopts it as a policy but, it is usually not made known to the public. Since we were told to state our tribes for the Dangote recruitment, it is very likely that Federal Character is one of their recruitment policies. To me, Dangote is looking at recruiting experts from all states in the federation.This could be a conduit to tap some political points in future. There are also rumours in circulation that the Dangote group has a very strong federal affiliation.

BlackHummer
ExposeThem101:
The whole process has lost its integrity. Now you need to know an insider to be shortlisted. Believe it or not, this is what is happening presently. I know some guys that have very excellent academic qualifications and did very well at the interview that are still waiting as we speak. Anyway, I wish the refinery project team all the best if that's what they want. I just feel for Dangote who doesn't know what's really happening.

Dangote knows what is happening it is just that he does not know how bad it is. So many coded nepotistic stunts and unprofessionlism in the company from asking us to state our tribes under the guise of federal character but a subtle instrument to choose the region they like, to shoving opening of first bank account and PSA account on us.

I have a friend who just came back from a univeristy in UK early this year (Msc Chemical Engr.) and the dude has already gotten an invite for medicals (Refinery, GT). He did not write the test. Infact, I know about 2 or 3 people from my university who didn't do test but have gone for training. Two of the guys i know are as dumb as rock (sorry but I just have to say it as it is) and they did not do the test. One is in refinery, the other is in the fertilizer plant. A third dude is very smart, he made a distinction in his Msc but they frustrated this guy's life for more than 14 months before he was called for medicals.

Honestly, between me and God, if you have another offer, go for it and forget dangote. This same nepotism has eaten deep into the company and will haunt you as you attempt to progress in the company. The company is like a typical nigerian community. Yea, there is a mix of merit based guys but the number of back door people are very much . Trust me. They only consider the common man when they cannot get one of their own to fill an imminent void or if he is just too outstanding....but even at that ...well...

Luckily for me, i just got admission for msc in UK and I will be dumping the process now even though I made it to the last stage. I honestly wish you all well.

Dangote group has zero integrity.
Eggovic

I also called a friend that is already back from India and he told me that the recruitment looked fairly transparent.
Finally, let us remember That the refinery is yet to start operations and adding so many trainees now will be like adding to the present overhead

Projects Faculties
Tue, Nov 12, 3:08 PM (1 day ago)

to ssvsan_2000, bcc: me

Dear Candidate

We are in receipt of your CV.

You are hereby invited for Interview on 15th Nov 2019 (Friday) at the address given below.

Dangote Refinery Site
E Block Office, 19A
Free Trade Zone
Ibeju - Lekki
Lagos

Contact person : Ms. Blessing,

Phone number : 08142780600

Time : 8 AM

While coming for the Interview you should bring below mentioned documents WITHOUT FAIL.

1. Fresh set of updated CV
2. Original and Photocopy of all Educational Certificates
3. Original and Photocopy of Service Certificates from all Companies where you worked.
4. 2 Passport size photographs
5. Offer Letter and latest 3 months payslip if you are currently working.
6. Print out of this mail as proof of Call up for Interview

All originals will be returned to you after verification.

PLEASE BE INFORMED THAT IF INTERVIEWS COULD NOT BE COMPLETED ON FRIDAY (15TH NOV 2019) IT MAY ROLL OVER TO NEXT DAY I.E., SATURDAY (16TH NOV 2019) AND YOU ARE ADVISED TO COME PREPARED FOR THE SAME.

Best wishes
Kohenphos

If you applied for any position then it is fine...the refinery recruits project staffs frequently and the interview may be conducted at the site. and yes that office address exist at the site, and you have gat most of the site HR there(maybe you may need to edit the contact off ur post),
But note whatever role if true is different from the Executive/Engineer trainee role, that follows a different process/HR system. Sorry I couldn't give my input earlier
Psychostevens
Who got anything like this?

We are in possession of your CV. We therefore wish to invite you for a Pre-employment Test holding in both Abuja and Lagos for a possible role in Dangote Cement Plc.

The Computer Based Test is scheduled as follows:

Date: 30th November 2019

Time: 8am prompt.

Venue Addresses:

·       Lagos:, JKK House, 229 Ikorodu Road, Ilupeju, (between Anthony Bus Stop and Obanikoro), Lagos

OR

·       Abuja;  Chamscity Exam Center, Sascon International School, 19, Yedseram Street Maitama, Abuja

You are free to go the center most convenient for you. Please confirm your availability for test and your preferred Test Center. In addition, complete the Identification Slip below and come along with it for identification.

Your confirmation to take the test must be communicated to...not later than Wednesday 20th November, 2019.

Monmarri
adamx23:

Bro, are you a candidate for fertilizer or cement?

I am for cement
Monmarri
Dangote cement does not have a structured HR. One should not just have hope that after medical u get the job offer. Just Keep praying. I am very surprised that after medical, they called me to negotiate salary, I told them the least I can take. They can't even pay experience candidate 200 above. They told me they will call me back, but they never did. This is one month now I never heard from them. They are not organised at all. Most companies I know will negotiate salary with u bf u go for medical, after medical u get y offer. I am disappointed in their HR structure.
Monmarri
Tinkel:
I applied for executive trainee (under electrical engineer) at dangote oil refinery company limited last year august(batch A). I went through all the five stages of the recruitment process ranging from aplitude test, group discussion, panel interview, psychometric test and medical test and by the grace of God I was able to scale through all this stages. Finally I was called to resume for the job this year, presently we are undergoing training in oil refinery operations outside the country.
My advice is that we don't need to get too anxious about this job, what I feel is the Success tips for the recruitment process of dangote oil refinery company are:
1. Group discussion, topics will range from Infrastructural development to health sector, oil Prices etc) during this interview, candidates must be calm, undominering, attentive, giving intelligent contribution).
2. Panel interview(ie one on one interview), if you are invited for this 3rd stage, make sure that you have a clear understanding of the basic concept of your discipline, the secret here is that your cv will play an important role here and it will determine the kind of questions that they will ask you, so make sure you are able to convinced your panelist of your past job experience relevant to your discipline, because most questions asked are very technical and it is discipline based. Be calm and also be confident of what ever you are saying.
3. Psychometric test, at this stage you will be given seven different questions papers to answer for a time duration of two hours, this test is know your personality and behavior under working conditions.
4. Medical test

How long after medicals did u get y offer? Was it long or short?

Congratulations! Master your CV, be confident, have the right attitude, use KISS style in answering their question and create a practical scenario to boost your point when they ask you technical question.
Know maintenance, SOP, circuit breaker type like Sf6 gas, Vacuum, electrical panel, voltage ratings HT and LT (33kV, 11kV, 415V three phase system) safety, neutral earthing, motor and drives, transformer, Delta Star connection, Star Delta connection, electrical symbols, single line diagram etc. Congrats once again.

Debbie1989
Job Title: Marketing Executive
Location: Lagos
Function: Sales/Marketing
Industry: Banking

Job Responsibilities:
• Identify and understand the need of the Customer.
• Sell the Banks Products proactively to new/prospective customers.
• Participate in tactical sales/marketing activities.
• Ensure timely submission of weekly sales activity reports to Direct Sales Manager.
• Participate in weekly/monthly sales performance review meetings.

Qualifications and Requirements
• 30 years and below.
• BSC/HND in any relevant discipline.
• Good communication skills and interpersonal skills.

Qualified and Interested candidates should apply through this link:
https://forms.gle/yZhUgbttKV797SWdA


Job Title: Bank Teller
Job Location: Lagos
Industry: Banking

Job Responsibilities
• Assisting customers with processing transactions, such as deposits, withdrawals, or payments, resolving complaints or account discrepancies, and answering questions.
• Informing customers about bank products and services.
• Tracking, recording, reporting, and storing information related to transactions, bank supplies, and customers, ensuring all information is accurate and complete.

Job Requirements
• OND only in any field.
• Must not be more than 27 years old.
• Cash handling experience and on-the-job training may be required.

Qualified and Interested candidates should please apply through this link below:
https://forms.gle/C5BfWAeYmV4Sr5Zv9




Job Title: Contact center agent
Job Location: Lagos
Industry: Banking

Summary:
We are currently recruiting Contact Center Agents for a reputable bank. H/She will be the liaison between the bank and its current and potential customers as well as able to accept ownership for effectively solving customer issues, complaints and inquiries; keeping customer satisfaction at the core of every decision and behaviour.

Responsibilities:
• Managing large amounts of inbound and outbound calls in a timely manner.
• Following call center “scripts” when handling different topics.
• Identifying customers’ needs, clarify information, research every issue and providing solutions.
• Meet personal/team qualitative and quantitative targets.
• Seize opportunities to upsell products when they arise.

Requirements:
• BSc/HND. in any discipline.
• 28 years old and below.
• Excellent spoken English with impressive interpersonal skills.

Qualified and interested persons should apply through the link:
https://forms.gle/PBm56cwZJqtomwrH9

























Job Title: Service Executives (SE)
Location: Lagos
Industry: Banking/ Financial Instiution

Job Description
* Attend to customers inquiries promptly and efficiently.
* Taking deposit from customers and crediting their accounts respectively.
* Collection and posting of dividend warrant.
* Processing of cheque lodgment for local and central clearing
* Opening of Savings and Current Accounts.
* Calling of tellers transaction on daily basis.
* Posting of profit and loss account.

Educational Qualification
* BSC or HND only (Minimum of Second Class Lower or Lower Credit)
* Not more than 27 years
* Experience in the banking industry will be an added advantage.

Qualified and interested candidates should please apply through the link below:
https://forms.gle/gVQUBAiWFtw8wVCk8

Timon4real
Please we need your advice for this group discussion/interview stage...
Please help guys..
God bless
olisa13
You guys will be divided into groups of ten to discuss while the interviewers watch. Each group will be given a topic (particularly on topical/global issues).

In my opinion, I'd advise you speak confidently and give your teammates time to speak too. It is somewhat an easy process and almost everyone makes it to the next stage.

Best of luck guys.
yahib
Hello guys, is there anyone here that took the online interview last weekend? Is the result out? Have they started contacting people?
Debbie1989
A commercial bank seeks to recruit self motivated, intelligent, young, articulate and dynamic professionals with integrity to fill the position below:

Job Title: Customer service executives
Location: Lagos

Job Description
* Manage large amounts of incoming phone calls.
* Identify and assess customers’ needs to achieve satisfaction.
* Build sustainable relationships and trust with customer accounts through open and interactive communication.
* Provide accurate, valid and complete information by using the right methods/tools.
* Meet personal/customer service team sales targets and call handling quotas.
* Handle customer complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits; follow up to ensure resolution.
* Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualification Requirements
* BSC/HND/OND/NCE only (Minimum of Second Class Lower or Lower Credit)
* Very quick learner
* Keen attention to details
* Good team player
* Relationship Management
* Problem Solving
* Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office Suite
* Strong computer skills
* Interpersonal skills
* Good written and oral communication
* Service orientation and strong Customer focus
* Integrity.

Qualified and interested candidates should please apply through the link below:
https://forms.gle/XYgurmJDZAmTy6A28

I am an electrical engineer,I am talking about their fertilizer plant because that's why I was invited for interview,after my interview about two months after they called me to submit my remaining documents in which I did,four months later they called me asking how I submitted my CV to dangote when applying for the job I answered but ever since then I have not heard from them ,this happened between March to September last year.talking about psychometric tests,at fertilizer I don't think they go through that process ,they invite you for oral interview and after if you made it they will contact you concerning any left documents you didn't submit the day of your interview if am not wrong so I don't think fertilizer plant do psychometric tests
Ananicoeji

lilyogo
Please i want to confirm if this is how dangote usually send out their interview invite across to applicants because i can't remember applying for any job there and this is the invite i got from there. Want to be sure is genuine so i don't waste transport going there.


Good day Candidate,



On behalf of Dangote Project Limited, we are pleased to invite you for an interview. Below are the details of the schedule;



Venue: Dangote Refinery Site.

E Block 19A,

Free Trade Zone, Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos

Date: Thursday 5th August, 2021.

Time: 8 am.



Please, it is very important that you come along with the documents listed below:

A copy of any recently taken passport photograph.
A copy of your recent Resume.


A). Academic credentials (originals and photocopies)

University degree, NYSC, WAEC, Primary School Certificate, and Birth Certificate
Relevant Certification and training stated on your CV.
B). Proof of work experiences indicated on your CV (originals and photocopies)

Last 3 months pay slip from your most recent employer.
Appointment Letter, Redundancy Letter/Acceptance of Resignation Letter or Certificate of Service and other relevant official letters from Past and Current Employer as stated on your CV.


Kindly acknowledge the receipt of this mail and endeavour to come along with a copy of this mail



Contact phone: 08159491468.

Acknowledged. Thank you for the opportunity
Show quoted text

Also received this
2nioshine
Timon4real:
Boss, any info as regard the executive trainee programme for the refinery?
Any recent intake so far
The ET scheme mandates all intake to undergo an oversee refinery training upon appointment of duty before confirmation, and this has been greatly affected by the COVID situation , the last recruited, over a year now are yet to travel, including another batch that are yet to resume. Hopefully when things gets better or if there is a change in the management's decision on training, the process should be much faster.
Timon4real
Thanks for the reply.
Well, I'm part of the batch that completed the psychometric test 3months ago although the opening was advertised last year December. Since then no reply.
I was thinking the travelling/training will have to stop since the refinery startup was said to be late this year/early next year. That's the training can be carried out here upon completion of the project.
Thanks for the update.
2nioshine:

The ET scheme mandates all intake to undergo an oversee refinery training upon appointment of duty before confirmation, and this has been greatly affected by the COVID situation , the last recruited, over a year now are yet to travel, including another batch that are yet to resume. Hopefully when things gets better or if there is a change in the management's decision on training, the process should be much faster.

2nioshine
Timon4real:
Thanks for the reply.
Well, I'm part of the batch that completed the psychometric test 3months ago although the opening was advertised last year December. Since then no reply.
I was thinking the travelling/training will have to stop since the refinery startup was said to be late this year/early next year. That's the training can be carried out here upon completion of the project.
Thanks for the update.
Prior to the second wave, about two batches were being prepared for trainings at different refineries at same time. which was usually not the case, same system may ramp up the numbers and pull in all on the waiting for the training when things gets better. stay patient and never idle while you wait, you will need this virtue lots more when you get into the system fully.
Amidst the COVID situation, there hasn't been any official reason for the delay in the oversea training.
Timon4real
Thanks for this update

Therefore, you can higher me for your children who is preparing for his/her common entrance or any entrance examination. You can also higher me for tutorial lessons to your friends, children, extended family and well wishers.
You can whatsapp / connect / contact me on 08067866727.
